comments.creator: alexhaan@aemail.nl
comments.raw_text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux i686; en-US; rv:1.8b5) Gecko/20051006 Firefox/1.4.1
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux i686; en-US; rv:1.8b5) Gecko/20051006 Firefox/1.4.1

The simplified source below results in the error listed.

The error points to the line the second parameter is on. But the problem is with
the first parameters. I have seen error logs that nicely gave the argument of
the function in error. It would have saved me hours if the error would have
simply listed the argument number.

JavaScript Console error:
-------------------------
Error: uncaught exception: [Exception... "Component returned failure code:
0x80070057 (NS_ERROR_ILLEGAL_VALUE) [nsIXSLTProcessor.transformToFragment]" 
nsresult: "0x80070057 (NS_ERROR_ILLEGAL_VALUE)"  location: "JS frame ::
http://cc8543-a.groni1.gr.home.nl:81/~armeagle/ctu/ind.php :: <TOP_LEVEL> ::
line 8"  data: no]

Html source:
------------
<!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD XHTML 1.0 Strict//EN"
"http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-strict.dtd">
<html><head><script type="text/javascript">
var xmlDoc;
var response;

var xsltProcessor = new XSLTProcessor();
var response = xsltProcessor.transformToFragment(xmlDoc,
				 document);
</script></head>
<body></body></html>

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open the JavaScript Console and clear it.
2. Open the url or preferably use the html source.
2. Check the JavaScript Console for the reported error.

Actual Results:  
I get the error listed in 'Details'.

Expected Results:  
I would expect either the correct line number, or the function argument number
causing the error.

comments.creator: tdowner@mozilla.com
comments.raw_text:
This bug was reported on Firefox 2.x or older, which is no longer supported and will not be receiving any more updates. I strongly suggest that you update to Firefox 3.6.3 or later, update your plugins (flash, adobe, etc.), and retest in a new profile. If you still see the issue with the updated Firefox, please post here. Otherwise, please close as RESOLVED > WORKSFORME
http://www.mozilla.com
http://support.mozilla.com/kb/Managing+profiles
http://support.mozilla.com/kb/Safe+mode

alexhaan@aemail.nl
comments.creator: alexhaan@aemail.nl
comments.text:
It's been a long time since I reported this. I don't even remember what project I wanted to use this for.

I read back my report and I wrote "I have seen error logs that nicely gave the argument of the function in error.". I don't even know how normal this is.

But I ran the same code in Firefox 3.6.4 and the error is still pointing to the line with 'document', not to the undefined valued xmlDoc.

I haven't used XSLT transformations since then, so I forgot the need or urgency for this. But it could still confuse someone. Not that anyone else seemed to have an issue so bad to find this bug report.

I guess in the literal sense of the words 'WORKSFORME' would be a valid assignment, even though it seems like the wrong behavior. I guess WONTFIX would suit it better.
comments.raw_text:
It's been a long time since I reported this. I don't even remember what project I wanted to use this for.

I read back my report and I wrote "I have seen error logs that nicely gave the argument of the function in error.". I don't even know how normal this is.

But I ran the same code in Firefox 3.6.4 and the error is still pointing to the line with 'document', not to the undefined valued xmlDoc.

I haven't used XSLT transformations since then, so I forgot the need or urgency for this. But it could still confuse someone. Not that anyone else seemed to have an issue so bad to find this bug report.

I guess in the literal sense of the words 'WORKSFORME' would be a valid assignment, even though it seems like the wrong behavior. I guess WONTFIX would suit it better.
WFM is if the issue is no longer present, but we don't know if there was another bug that fixed it. WONTFIX is if the developers are not going to fix the bug.
comments.text: WFM is if the issue is no longer present, but we don't know if there was another bug that fixed it. WONTFIX is if the developers are not going to fix the bug.

comments.text: No reply, INCOMPLETE. Please retest with Firefox 3.6.x or later and a new profile (http://support.mozilla.com/kb/Managing+profiles). If you continue to see this issue with the newest firefox and a new profile, then please comment on this bug.
comments.raw_text: No reply, INCOMPLETE. Please retest with Firefox 3.6.x or later and a new profile (http://support.mozilla.com/kb/Managing+profiles). If you continue to see this issue with the newest firefox and a new profile, then please comment on this bug.

comments.text: Why did you mark this FIXED?
comments.raw_text: Why did you mark this FIXED?
comments.creator: tdowner@mozilla.com
comments.author: tdowner@mozilla.com
alexhaan@aemail.nl
comments.raw_text:
Did I? I only cleared the URL. Though now you say so, at the top it says "RESOLVED INCOMPLETE" while below this text area the dropdowns show "RESOLVED" and "FIXED" as selected. Actually, I cannot set a combination of "RESOLVED" and "INCOMPLETE". So it defaults to "RESOLVED FIXED".

I searched for this and it has been reported recently: bug 562650
comments.text:

comments.creator: alexhaan@aemail.nl
alexhaan@aemail.nl
comments.text:
Together with that update I also tested whether I could spoof the contents of the dropdown. That way I could set the resolution to INCOMPLETE (just to explain why the status hasn't changed this time, I'll mention it in that bug report/look for something similar).

Back to the bug though. (Though I mentioned before that I reproduced the issue in a 3.6.4 browser, I'm not sure whether I used a clear profile then) I just started a new profile, ran it in safe-mode and opened a file with above mentioned contents. The issue still remains, pointing to the line after the actual issue.

To be honest I really wonder whether this is still worth the time and effort.


Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 6.1; en-GB; rv:1.9.2.4) Gecko/20100513 Firefox/3.6.4

Error: uncaught exception: [Exception... "Component returned failure code: 0x80070057 (NS_ERROR_ILLEGAL_VALUE) [nsIXSLTProcessor.transformToFragment]"  nsresult: "0x80070057 (NS_ERROR_ILLEGAL_VALUE)"  location: "JS frame :: file:///C:/Users/ArmEagle/Documents/xslttest.html :: <TOP_LEVEL> :: line 9"  data: no]
